pullRequest.title: Remove mentions of "Spacewalk" and "Satellite" from API docs
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
This patch is removing mentions of "Spacewalk" and "Satellite" from the API docs. Those mentions are confusing to users as neither Spacewalk nor Satellite is involved. General algorithm that is followed here:

API docs: "Satellite" (the product) and "Satellite admin" (the role) -> "Uyuni" and "Uyuni admin" (via the #product() macro).
In corresponding Javadoc comments: avoid mentions of the product name and use a more generic wording, use product admin when referring to the role.

TODO:

 Remove the deprecated satellite namespace (SatelliteHandler.java).
 Make sure that the handler removal is added to the release notes for upcoming releases (ping @juliogonzalez).
 Replace "Red Hat Errata" with "patches".
 Take advantage of the existing #product() macro.
 Understand what is done in OrgHandler.setOrgConfigManagedByOrgAdmin() and why it has an impact on performance.
 Create a separate issue to actually replace satellite_admin in the code and database (maybe with product_admin?).

GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed, this patch is actually changing the API docs.


 DONE


Test coverage


No tests needed, only API docs are affected.


 DONE


Links
Fixes SUSE/spacewalk#12689.

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below).
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_lint_checkstyle"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

nodes.bodyText:
satellite_admin is the role label in DB. The text version is SUSE Manager Administrator.
So maybe we write not "#product() admin" but "#product() Administrator" ?
Here and below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -60,7 +60,7 @@
      *
      * @xmlrpc.doc Set whether we should keeps roles assigned to users because of
      * their IPA groups even after they log in through a non-IPA method. Can only be
-     * called by a satellite_admin.
+     * called by a #product() admin.

Remove mentions of "Satellite" from API docs
